author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In battle 'gainst inflation's fearsome tide,
The ECB doth raise its shield and sword,
But cautious be, lest harm doth take its side,
Amundi warns, the cycle's pace to slow.

As oil and sea doth drop their precious load,
With Mobil's Exxon and Chevron's might,
Their profits, like famed warriors of old,
Stand strong, resurgent 'midst the ebbing flow.

Now hear the tale of Beijing's rise once more,
But woe betide, the saboteur doth lurk,
As state extends its ever-reaching hand,
Espionage and raids doth harm conspire.

feedItems.title: ECB Likely to Stay Cautious With Rate Rises Despite Inflation Fight
feedItems.description: The ECB’s fight against inflation remains relentless but its wariness over the economic impact of the tightening cycle is likely to make it slow the pace of its interest-rate rise next week, according to asset manager Amundi.

feedItems.title: Exxon, Chevron Profits Are Resilient Even as Oil Prices Drop
feedItems.description: Exxon Mobil and Chevron collectively posted $18 billion in first-quarter profits, showing resilient performance even as oil and natural-gas prices declined.

feedItems.title: Beijing's Bain Raid, Espionage Law are Self-Sabotage
feedItems.description: China’s economy is bouncing back. Recent moves show that the potential for state overreach is, too.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Rusland's realm, a missile's might,
To Ukraine's cities doth bring blight;
Mourning thirteen, as fate unfurls,
The drone's cold wrath upon this world.

The Bank of China, known by name IC,
Revealèd growth so near to be;
Yet hark, the first, the quarter's tale,
The whining drop of interest, doth weep and fail.

In twisted quest, she breeds anew,
An AI clone, with whispers true;
Her bank and kin, beguiled so deep,
By eerie likeness, nightmares doth reap.

feedItems.title: Russian Missile Barrage Kills 13 in Ukraine
feedItems.description: Russia targeted cities across Ukraine in the most severe missile barrage in more than a month, killing at least 13 people, as the Kremlin called for expanding the development and use of drones.

feedItems.title: ICBC Reported Flat Net-Profit Growth in First Quarter
feedItems.description: Industrial & Commercial Bank of China reported flat growth in first-quarter net profit and a 4.8% drop in net interest income.

feedItems.title: I Cloned Myself With AI. She Fooled My Bank and My Family.
feedItems.description: Our columnist replaced herself with AI voice and video to see how humanlike the tech can be. The results were eerie.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Of troubled banks and blunders' tale,
Stricter bounds to mend their strife,
Silent postmortems to unveil,
The realm seeks solace from their strife.

In lands far, in sing'd city dear,
Rents sore increase, boundless they grow,
Where tenants face a dread and fear,
In Metropolis, their woes doth show.

As growth of wage and prices dance,
The watchful Fed to ponder rate,
To weigh their steps, not left to chance,
Their wise decision we await.

feedItems.title: Regulators to Publish Postmortems on SVB, Signature Failures
feedItems.description: The reports are expected to include recommendations for stricter regulation of regional banks.

feedItems.title: 'That's Just Crazy': The Metropolis Where Rents Rise 60%, 75%, Even 100%
feedItems.description: It’s a tough time to be a tenant in Singapore, with rent increases outpacing those in London and New York.

feedItems.title: Wage Growth, Inflation Data to Inform Fed Before Rate Decision
feedItems.description: The government will release the employment-cost index and the price gauge watched by the central bank.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Of yonder land where skies doth weep,
In shadows cast, clean powers creep,
Though fervent Europe giveth chase,
To Uncle Sam's green bounty race.

As chargers fill the inns with ease,
Ere night descends on horseless steeds,
A battle grim for youthful sparks,
To drink, perchance to quench in dark.

Too many seats, but bottoms few,
In tavern halls where silence grew,
Away the feast, and call for change!
This realm of mirth doth rearrange.

feedItems.title: Europe's Green-Energy Push Struggles to Match U.S. Momentum
feedItems.description: Solar and other clean-energy initiatives in Europe are being overshadowed as U.S. tax credits draw the focus of investors.

feedItems.title: The Most Annoying Hotel Guest Is the EV Charger Hog
feedItems.description: More electric vehicles mean more competition for chargers during overnight stays.

feedItems.title: 'Too Many Seats, Too Few Butts' Mean Changes at Your Favorite Restaurant
feedItems.description: As eating out is replaced by ordering out, restaurant real estate gets a radical makeover
